IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROTECT AND RESTORE THE REGION'S LAND AND WATER, CREATE GARDENS AND GREEN SPACES, AND PRESERVE FALLINGWATER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY PROTECTS AND RESTORES EXCEPTIONAL PLACES TO PROVIDE OUR REGION WITH CLEAN WATERS AND HEALTHY FORESTS, WILDLIFE AND NATURAL AREAS FOR THE BENEFIT OF PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS. THE CONSERVANCY CREATES GREEN SPACES AND GARDENS, CONTRIBUTING TO THE VITALITY OF OUR CITIES AND TOWNS, AND PRESERVES FALLINGWATER, A SYMBOL OF PEOPLE LIVING IN HARMONY WITH NATURE.
IRS990.Desc: LAND CONSERVATION PROGRAM: THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES LAND PROTECTION, LAND STEWARDSHIP, NATURAL HERITAGE AND CONSERVATION SCIENCE. THESE PROGRAMS FOCUS ON THE CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION OF THE REGION'S NATURAL AREAS. WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY HAS HELPED ESTABLISH TEN STATE PARKS AND CONSERVED MORE THAN 252,000 ACRES OF NATURAL LANDS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FALLINGWATER ADMINISTRATION AND EDUCATION PROGRAM: FALLINGWATER IS FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT'S WORLD-FAMOUS MASTERWORK. A HOUSE THAT IS OPERATED AS AN ARCHITECTURAL MUSEUM, FALLINGWATER SYMBOLIZES PEOPLE LIVING IN HARMONY WITH NATURE. FALLINGWATER HOSTS CLOSE TO 167,000 VISITORS, INCLUDING MORE THAN 10,000 STUDENTS, EACH YEAR. FALLINGWATER ALSO PROVIDES CURRICULUM PLANS FOR TEACHERS TO INTEGRATE INTO THEIR CLASSROOMS AND CONDUCTS LECTURES, EXHIBITIONS AND TOURS OF VARIOUS KINDS TO HELP LIFELONG LEARNERS ADVANCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE ABOUT ART, ARCHITECTURE AND NATURE. FALLINGWATER OFFERS ON-SITE WORKSHOPS AND INTERNSHIPS TO FURTHER ENHANCE THE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES AVAILABLE AT THE LOCATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY GARDENS & GREENSPACE: THIS PROGRAM IMPLEMENTS HIGH IMPACT GREENING PROJECTS TO PROMOTE ATTRACTIVE AND HEALTHY ENVIRONMENTS AND LIVABLE PLACES. SUPPORTED BY STRATEGIC PARTNERS AND OVER 12,000 VOLUNTEERS, THE PROGRAM ANNUALLY FACILITATES 130 COMMUNITY FLOWER GARDENS, 21 COMMUNITY VEGETABLE GARDENS, AND 1,400 URBAN FLORAL BASKETS AND PLANTERS ALONG CITY STREETS, IMPLEMENTS NATURAL GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS TO HELP MANAGE STORM WATER DURING WET WEATHER CONDITIONS, AND SINCE 2008, HAS PLANTED 25,300 TREES IN ALLEGHENY COUNTY.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: WATERSHED CONSERVATION PROGRAM: THE WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY'S WATERSHED CONSERVATION PROGRAM PROTECTS AND RESTORES OUR REGION'S RIVERS AND STREAMS FOR THE LONG-TERM BENEFIT OF PEOPLE AND WILDLIFE. WE PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES AND LOCAL WATERSHED GROUPS, HELPING WITH PROJECT IDENTIFICATION, IMPLEMENTATION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT. WE ALSO PARTNER WITH INDIVIDUAL LANDOWNERS AND BUSINESSES TO HELP THEM IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT ON THEIR PROPERTIES. WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY HAS PROTECTED OR RESTORED 3,000 MILES OF RIVERS AND STREAMS.
OTHER: THESE SERVICES CONSIST OF THE PREPARATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS REGARDING CONSERVATION, ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE, ECOLOGICAL RESEARCH, ARCHITECTURE, AND COMMUNITY GREENING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EASEMENT WAS MODIFIED BECAUSE FORMER OWNERS BUILT A SMALL STUDIO/COTTAGE ON 0.05 ACRE OUTSIDE THE BUILDING LIMIT (DISCOVERED IN 2013). AFTER BEING NOTIFIED OF THE VIOLATION, THE OWNERS SOLD THE PROPERTY. EVENTUALLY, THE NEW OWNER AGREED TO EXTINGUISH 0.10 ACRE OF REMAINING BUILDING RIGHTS IN EXCHANGE FOR MODIFYING THE BUILIDNG LIMIT TO INCLUDE THE STUDIO/COTTAGE. THE AGREEMENT WAS SIGNED IN 2015 AND WAS RECORDED IN 2016. A 2014 EASEMENT WAS MODIFIED TO INCREASE THE MINIMUM PROTECTION AREA TO PERMIT DEVELOPMENT NEEDS OF THE HOLDER AND TO INCREASE THE HIGH PROTECTION AREA. THE REVISION INCREASED THE OVERALL PROTECTION OF THE EASEMENT BY INCREASING THE MOST RESTRICTIVE HIGH PROTECTION AREA ACREAGE (7.9 ACRES) MORE THAN THE INCREASE OF THE MINIMUM PROTECTION AREA ACREAGE (6.7 ACRES). A 2015 AMENDMENT REDUCED THE OVERALL SIZE OF 'BUILDING ENVELOPE A' BY APPROXIMATELY 0.7 ACRES (FROM APPROXIMATELY 11.07 ACRES TO APPROXIMATELY 10.44 ACRES); REVISED THE SHAPE OF 'BUILDING ENVELOPE A' TO REFLECT THE REDUCED SIZE; EXTINGUISHED THE 1.5-ACRE BUILDING ENVELOPE AND SUBDIVISION RIGHT CURRENTLY PERMITTED IN THE EASEMENT ON "PARCEL B" OF THE PROPERTY; AND UPDATED THE LANGUAGE IN THE EASEMENT TO ALLOW HOME OFFICE-BASED BUSINESSES TO BE CONDUCTED IF NEITHER THE BUSINESS NOR THE USES SUCH AS PARKING OR SIGNAGE ARE VISIBLE OR DISCERNABLE OUTSIDE THE STRUCTURES. A 2015 AMENDMENT EXPANDED AN EXISTING CONSERVATION EASEMENT, WHICH WAS DONATED OVER A 195-ACRE PROPERTY IN 2009, TO COVER 146 ADDITIONAL ACRES ADJACENT TO THE ORIGINAL PROPERTY. THE OWNERS PURCHASED THIS ADDITIONAL ACREAGE IN 2014. THE AMENDMENT EXPANDEDED THE EXISTING EASEMENT PROTECTIONS OVER THE NEW PROPERTY, PROVIDED SPECIFIC RESTRICTIONS OVER THE NEW LAND, AND ALSO CLARIFIED A TERM IN THE ORIGINAL EASEMENT. AN APPROXIMATE 2.94-ACRE PORTION OF A 1,271-ACRE CONSERVATION EASEMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE EASEMENT AFTER THE LAND WAS CONDEMNED FOR THE PURPOSE OF CONSTRUCTING A SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT. IN EXCHANGE, A NEARBY 3-ACRE PROPERTY WAS ADDED TO THE SAME EASEMENT. IN 2011, A LOCAL WATER AUTHORITY (AUTHORITY) CONDEMNED 2.304 ACRES OF A 2,528-ACRE CONSERVATION EASEMENT HELD BY THE CONSERVANCY ON PROPERTY OWNED BY A BUSINESS (BUSINESS) IN UPPER YODER TOWNSHIP, CAMBRIA COUNTY, FOR A WATER LINE. THE AUTHORITY ALSO CONDEMNED THE FEE SIMPLE INTEREST OWNED BY THE BUSINESS IN THAT SAME 2.304 ACRE PROPERTY. IN 2015, AS COMPENSATION TO THE CONSERVANCY FOR THE TAKING THE 2.304 ACRES OF THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT FOR THE WATER LINE, THE AUTHORITY PLACED UNDER CONSERVATION EASEMENT A PORTION OF THEIR LAND ALONG THE BOUNDARY OF THE BUSINESS'S PROPERTY. THE PORTION OF THE AUTHORITY'S PROPERTY PLACED UNDER EASEMENT IS 51.25' WIDE AND 3,908.95 FEET LONG, ENCOMPASSING 4.599 ACRES. THE TERMS OF THE NEW EASEMENT ARE THE SAME AS THOSE ON THE BUSINESS PROPERTY, WITH AN ADDITIONAL RESTRICTION PROHIBITING SUBDIVISION OF THE EASED PORTION OF THE PROPERTY FROM THE LARGER PARCEL OWNED BY THE AUTHORITY.

THE CONSERVANCY ACQUIRES, PROTECTS, AND HOLDS LAND FOR CONSERVATION PURPOSES. LAND IS VALUED AT COST OR, IN THE CASE OF DONATED LAND, AT FAIR VALUE ON THE DATE OF THE CONTRIBUTION. THE CONSERVANCY CAPITALIZES CERTAIN COSTS INCURRED DURING THE TIME THE LAND IS BEING ACQUIRED AND PROTECTION ACTIVITIES ARE UNDERWAY. THE COSTS INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT, LAND IMPROVEMENTS, LEGAL FEES, AND MISCELLANEOUS OTHER ITEMS. GRANTS RECEIVED AS REIMBURSEMENT FOR LAND COSTS ON PROJECTS WHERE THE CONSERVANCY DOES NOT INTEND TO HOLD THE LAND FOR LONG-TERM PURPOSES REDUCE THE COST OF THE LAND. THE CONSERVANCY HOLDS CERTAIN CONSERVATION EASEMENTS AND DEED RESTRICTIONS (EASEMENTS). THE CONSERVANCY OBTAINS EASEMENTS BY THE SALE OF A PIECE OF LAND OWNED BY THE CONSERVANCY, WHERE PART OF THE AGREEMENT IS THAT THE CONSERVANCY RETAINS THE CONSERVATION EASEMENT ON THE LAND. THE CONSERVANCY ALSO OBTAINS EASEMENTS FROM THIRD PARTIES BY DONATION, OR BY RESERVATION OF RIGHTS UPON SALE OF LAND, UNDER WHICH A THIRD PARTY MAINTAINS ITS OWNERSHIP OF THE UNDERLYING LAND. EASEMENTS ACQUIRED THROUGH DONATION AND EASEMENTS ESTABLISHED BY RESERVATION OF RIGHTS ARE NOT RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, THE CONSERVANCY OBTAINS EASEMENTS THROUGH PURCHASES DIRECTLY FROM OWNERS. PURCHASED EASEMENTS ARE RECORDED AT COST AND REDUCED TO A CARRYING VALUE OF $1 BY THE AMOUNT OF ANY RESTRICTED GRANTS RECEIVED SPECIFICALLY FOR THE EASEMENT PURCHASES AND BY EXPENSING THE AMOUNT OF THE EASEMENT PURCHASE FUNDED BY UNRESTRICTED REVENUE. AS DISCUSSED ABOVE, GRANTS RECEIVED AS REIMBURSEMENT FOR LAND COSTS ON LAND CONSERVATION PROJECTS WHERE THE CONSERVANCY DOES NOT INTEND TO HOLD THE LAND FOR THE LONG-TERM REDUCE THE COST BASIS OF THE LAND. THE CONSERVANCY RECEIVED A GRANT OF $6,735,918 FROM A PRIVATE FOUNDATION FOR SUCH A PROJECT IN 2015. ACCORDINGLY, THIS GRANT WAS NOT REFLECTED AS REVENUE BUT RATHER AS A REDUCTION OF THE LAND COST WITHIN THE LAND CONSERVATION PROJECTS BALANCE SHEET ACCOUNT. ACCORDINGLY, THE GRANT IS NOT REFLECTED AS CONTRIBUTION REVENUE IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1 AND THEREFORE, IS NOT INCLUDED AS SUPPORT FOR THE SCHEDULE A, PART II OR ON SCHEDULE B.

FALLINGWATER WAS DESIGNED IN 1935 BY FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT AS A WEEKEND HOUSE FOR THE EDGAR J. KAUFMANN FAMILY OF PITTSBURGH. CONSTRUCTED BETWEEN 1936 AND 1939, IT COMBINED INNOVATIVE ENGINEERING AND DESIGN WITH MODERN MATERIALS IN A WAY THAT HELPED INSTILL MODERNISM AS A POWERFUL MOVEMENT IN AMERICA. DRAMATICALLY CANTILEVERED OVER THE WATERFALL OF BEAR RUN, THE HOUSE WAS CONSTRUCTED OF REINFORCED CONCRETE AND NATIVE SANDSTONE QUARRIED ON THE SITE. IT IS COMPRISED OF A SERIES OF REINFORCED CONCRETE TRAYS STACKED ONE UPON THE OTHER AND SEPARATED BY STONE PIERS. THE FIRST FLOOR CONSISTS OF THE LIVING, DINING AND KITCHEN AREAS; THE SECOND AND THIRD LEVELS HAVE A TOTAL OF FOUR BEDROOMS EACH WITH A BATH AND TERRACE. CLIMBING THE HILL BEHIND THE HOUSE IS THE GUEST HOUSE AND SERVANTS QUARTERS. FALLINGWATER'S ART COLLECTION IS COMPRISED OF MORE THAN 950 WORKS OF FINE AND DECORATIVE ART INCLUDING PRINTS, PAINTINGS, SCULPTURE, FURNITURE, CERAMICS, ART GLASS, AND MISCELLANEOUS HOUSEHOLD OBJECTS. OF PARTICULAR SIGNIFICANCE IN THE COLLECTION ARE THE 169 PIECES OF ORIGINAL WALNUT FURNITURE, CUSTOM DESIGNED BY FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT FOR FALLINGWATER. THESE PIECES REPRESENT ONE OF THE MOST COMPLETE ENSEMBLES OF WRIGHT DESIGNED, SITE-SPECIFIC FURNITURE. THE REMAINING ARTIFACTS ON DISPLAY REPRESENT AN ECLECTIC RANGE OF OBJECTS COLLECTED BY THE KAUFMANN FAMILY. THEY UNDERLINE THE FAMILY'S BELIEF IN THE POWER OF GOOD DESIGN TO ENRICH THE QUALITY OF MODERN LIFE, A BELIEF SHARED BY FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT. IN ADDITION TO WORKS OF ART, THERE ARE 1,340 FAMILY BOOKS, INCLUDING AN IMPORTANT COLLECTION OF ARCHITECTURAL BOOKS. THE FALLINGWATER ARCHIVES CONTAIN: 396 PHOTOGRAPHS (1880-1996) OF THE BEAR RUN REGION, FALLINGWATER AND SURROUNDING PROPERTY, CONSTRUCTION OF THE HOUSE, AND MEMBERS OF THE EDGAR J. KAUFMANN FAMILY; 875 PHOTOGRAPHS OF WESTERN PA BY REGIONAL PHOTOGRAPHER LUKE SWANK; 1,100 DOCUMENTS (1934-1989) RELATING TO THE KAUFMANN FAMILY'S OWNERSHIP AND ASSOCIATION WITH FALLINGWATER; 16 MAPS OF THE SURROUNDING AREA, 3 ORIGINAL PENCIL DRAWINGS BY VICTOR HAMMER; 150 COPIES OF DRAWINGS PRODUCED BY WRIGHT FOR THE KAUFMANNS (THE ORIGINALS WERE PLACED AT COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY'S AVERY LIBRARY BY EDGAR KAUFMANN, JR. PRIOR TO HIS GIFT OF FALLINGWATER TO THE WPC); 108 PUBLICATIONS RELATED TO THE HOUSE AND FAMILY; 60 MINUTES OF BLACK AND WHITE FILM FOOTAGE THAT INCLUDES HOME MOVIES OF THE FAMILY, THE BEAR RUN PROPERTY PRIOR TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF FALLINGWATER, AND FILMS OF THE CONSTRUCTION ITSELF; 5 VIDEO TAPES AND 25 ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS OF FORMER KAUFMANN EMPLOYEES AND FRIENDS, AND APPROXIMATELY 1,000 PIECES OF ORIGINAL KAUFMANN CORRESPONDENCE. A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK SINCE 1976, FALLINGWATER IS AN INTERNATIONAL TREASURE. IN 2000, THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA NAMED FALLINGWATER A COMMONWEALTH TREASURE, AND A SURVEY OF THE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF ARCHITECTS' MEMBERS VOTED FALLINGWATER THE BUILDING OF THE CENTURY, BY A 3-TO-1 MARGIN. IN 2015, FALLINGWATER WAS PUT FORTH BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE FOR CONSIDERATION AS A UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITE WITH NINE OTHER WRIGHT BUILDINGS. IT IS THE ONLY MAJOR WRIGHT-DESIGNED BUILDING TO HAVE COME INTO THE PUBLIC DOMAIN INTACT, COMPLETE WITH THE BUILDING, LANDSCAPE, ORIGINAL WRIGHT-DESIGNED FURNISHINGS, AND FAMILY'S ART COLLECTION. FALLINGWATER AND ITS COLLECTIONS ARE AN INVALUABLE PUBLIC RESOURCE. WITH CLOSE TO 167,000 VISITORS ANNUALLY, THE MUSEUM SERVES AS AN EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL INSTITUTION FOR THE GLOBAL COMMUNITY.

THE CONSERVANCY'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF VARIOUS INVESTMENT FUNDS ESTABLISHED PRIMARILY FOR THE FINANCIAL NEEDS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND ITS PURPOSE. THE ENDOWMENT INCLUDES ONLY DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND ACCUMULATED INCOME THEREON. CERTAIN ENDOWMENT EARNINGS ARE DONOR RESTRICTED FOR A PARTICULAR PROGRAM. IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATE LAW, ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE BOARD, IN WRITING, ELECTS A SPENDING RATE OF BETWEEN 2% AND 7%.

THE CONSERVANCY HAS BEEN GRANTED AN EXEMPTION FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) HAS CLASSIFIED THE CONSERVANCY AS OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE CONSERVANCY IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX ON CERTAIN INCOME THAT IS CONSIDERED UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, IF EARNED. THE CONSERVANCY ANNUALLY FILES A FORM 990. THE CONSERVANCY HAS ASSESSED THE TAX POSITIONS IT HAS TAKEN OR EXPECTS TO TAKE IN ITS TAX RETURNS AND NO LIABILITY HAS BEEN DETERMINED TO BE NECESSARY.
ADJUSTMENT IN CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES -1,731. RENTAL EXPENSES 127,840. COST OF GOODS SOLD 954,122.
RENTAL EXPENSES 127,840. COST OF GOODS SOLD 954,122.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: RIPARIAN COASTERS AND CANOE ACCESS DEVELOPMENT
CANOE ACCESS DEVELOPMENT AND GENESEE HEADWATERS ASSOCIATION OPERATING AND OUTREACH

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY PROVIDES RELATIVELY FEW GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS, AND FOR THOSE GRANTS THAT ARE MADE, THE CONSERVANCY REQUIRES REPORTS TO ENSURE GRANTS ARE EXPENDED FOR STATED PURPOSE, STATUS UPDATES ON THE PROJECT, AND APPROVAL OF CONSTRUCTION DESIGNS FOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THOSE PERSONS, OR ORGANIZATIONS CONSISTING OF PERSONS GROUPED TOGETHER, WHOSE AIMS AND ACTIONS ARE COMPATIBLE WITH THE PURPOSES OF THIS CORPORATION AND WHO MEET SUCH REQUIREMENTS FOR REGULAR MEMBERSHIP OR AFFILIATIONS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, SHALL BE ELIGIBLE FOR MEMBERSHIP OR AFFILIATION TO THE CORPORATION. CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP - THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY CREATE CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP OR CHANGE CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP AT ITS SOLE DISCRETION. HONORARY MEMBERSHIP - INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE RENDERED EMINENT SERVICE IN THE AREAS OF ENDEAVOR ENUMERATED IN THE PURPOSE CLAUSE OF THE CORPORATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, OR WHO HAVE RENDERED EMINENT SERVICE TO THE CORPORATION, MAY BE NOMINATED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR ELECTION TO HONORARY MEMBERSHIP BY VOTE OF THE MEMBERSHIP AT AN ANNUAL MEETING OF MEMBERS. HONORARY MEMBERS SHALL BE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION FOR LIFE. LIFE MEMBERSHIP - INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE LIFE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION ON THE DATE OF THE ANNUAL MEETING OF MEMBERS IN 1970 SHALL CONTINUE THEREAFTER FOR THEIR RESPECTIVE LIVES AS LIFE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION. POWER TO VOTE AND HOLD OFFICE - INDIVIDUAL REGULAR MEMBERS AND LIFE MEMBERS SHALL HAVE POWER TO VOTE AND HOLD OFFICE. ORGANIZATIONS AND HONORARY MEMBERS SHALL HAVE NO VOTE AND SHALL NOT BE ELIGIBLE TO HOLD OFFICE. RESIGNATION - ANY MEMBER MAY RESIGN HIS MEMBERSHIP IN THE CORPORATION BY NOTIFYING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF HIS DESIRE TO RESIGN. SUSPENSION OR EXPULSION - ANY MEMBER MAY BE SUSPENDED OR EXPELLED BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS ELECT BOARD MEMBERS. THE BOARD ELECTS OFFICERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INITIAL REVIEWS OF FORM 990 WERE PERFORMED BY UPPER MANAGEMENT AND APPLICABLE STAFF. FINAL REVIEWS ARE PERFORMED BY THE ENTIRE BOARD. CHANGES NEEDED PURSUANT TO REVIEWS ARE INCORPORATED BEFORE FINAL ISSUANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH DIRECTOR, PRINCIPAL OFFICER, MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS AND SENIOR EXECUTIVE TEAM MEMBERS SHALL ANNUALLY RECEIVE A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS SUCH PERSON: A. HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY, B. HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, C. HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, AND D. UNDERSTANDS THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS CHARITABLE AND IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. AN INDIVIDUAL'S FAILURE TO SUBMIT A SIGNED ANNUAL STATEMENT WILL RESULT IN THE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION WHICH MAY INCLUDE REMOVAL FROM THE GOVERNING BOARD OR ANY COMMITTEE OR TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT. THE PRESIDENT/CEO AND CFO SHALL MAINTAIN A LIST OF ALL BOARD OF DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND SENIOR STAFF TO WHOM THIS POLICY STATEMENT APPLIES. THE PRESIDENT SHALL DISTRIBUTE ANNUALLY A COPY OF THIS POLICY TO THOSE INDIVIDUALS TO WHOM IT APPLIES. TO ENSURE THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AND DOES NOT ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT COULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, PERIODIC REVIEWS SHALL BE CONDUCTED. THE PERIODIC REVIEWS SHALL, AT A MINIMUM, INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING SUBJECTS: A. WHETHER COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS AND BENEFITS ARE REASONABLE, BASED ON COMPETENT SURVEY INFORMATION, AND THE RESULT OF ARM'S LENGTH BARGAINING. B. WHETHER PARTNERSHIPS, JOINT VENTURES, AND ARRANGEMENTS WITH MANAGEMENT ORGANIZATIONS CONFORM TO THE ORGANIZATION'S WRITTEN POLICIES, ARE PROPERLY RECORDED, REFLECT REASONABLE INVESTMENT OR PAYMENTS FOR GOODS AND SERVICES, FURTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AND DO NOT RESULT IN INUREMENT, IMPERMISSIBLE PRIVATE BENEFIT OR IN AN EXCESS BENEFIT TRANSACTION. WHEN CONDUCTING THE PERIODIC REVIEWS AS PROVIDED FOR IN ARTICLE VII, THE ORGANIZATION MAY, BUT NEED NOT, USE OUTSIDE ADVISORS. IF OUTSIDE EXPERTS ARE USED, THEIR USE SHALL NOT RELIEVE THE GOVERNING BOARD OF ITS RESPONSIBILITY FOR ENSURING PERIODIC REVIEWS ARE CONDUCTED. IF THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE HAS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE A MEMBER HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, IT SHALL INFORM THE MEMBER OF THE BASIS FOR SUCH BELIEF AND AFFORD THE MEMBER AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLAIN THE ALLEGED FAILURE TO DISCLOSE. IF, AFTER HEARING THE MEMBER'S RESPONSE AND AFTER MAKING FURTHER INVESTIGATION AS WARRANTED BY THE CIRCUMSTANCES, THE GOVERNING BOARD OR COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE MEMBER HAS FAILED TO DISCLOSE AN ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST, IT SHALL TAKE APPROPRIATE DISCIPLINARY AND CORRECTIVE ACTION WHICH MAY INCLUDE, REMOVAL FROM THE GOVERNING BOARD AND TERMINATION OF SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WPC UTILIZES AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTING FIRM TO REVIEW ITS WAGE AND SALARY PROGRAM, GENERALLY EVERY TWO YEARS. EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED MORE FREQUENTLY. MULTIPLE EXTERNAL SALARY SOURCES ARE USED FOR MARKET COMPARISONS FOR BENCHMARKED POSITIONS. IN REVIEWING COMPENSATION, 8 EXTERNAL SALARY SOURCES ARE UTILIZED FOR COMPARISON PURPOSES: 1. ECONOMIC RESEARCH INSTITUTE - EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION ASSESSOR 2. COMPENSATION IN NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS - ABBOT, LANGER & ASSOCIATES 3. EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION - NON PROFIT SURVEY PRM CONSULTING 4. COMPENSATION DATA, PENNSYLVANIA - THE PENNSYLVANIA CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND COMPDATA SURVEYS. 5. SURVEY OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION - BUSINESS AND LEGAL REPORTS, INC. 6. EXECUTIVE SALARY AND BENEFITS SURVEY - AMERICAN SOCIETY OF ASSOCIATION EXECUTIVES. 7. TOP MANAGEMENT REPORT - WATSON WYATT 8. INDEPENDANT CONSULTANT'S CONFIDENTIAL CLIENT FILES IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN A COMPETITIVE AND EQUITABLE SALARY STRUCTURE, WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY UNDERTAKES AN INDEPENDENT MARKET REVIEW OF SALARIES FOR ALL STAFF BI-ANNUALLY. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AUTHORIZED THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD TO REVIEW AND APPROVE ALL EXECUTIVE SALARY CHANGES UNDER IRS INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS RULES FOR DISQUALIFIED PERSONS. IN ADDITION TO THE PRESIDENT/CEO, THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE SETS COMPENSATION FOR THE VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE/CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER; VICE PRESIDENT, FALLINGWATER; VICE PRESIDENT, LAND CONSERVATION; VICE PRESIDENT, INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT; ASSOCIATE VICE PRESIDENT, WATERSHED CONSERVATION; VICE PRESIDENT, GOVERNMENT AND COMMUNITY RELATIONS. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS AND APPROVES ALL EXECUTIVE SALARY CHANGES UNDER IRS INTERMEDIATE SANCTION RULES FOR DISQUALIFIED PERSONS. WPC INCLUDES IN THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION REVIEW ANY EMPLOYEE OPERATING WITH AN OFFICER TITLE (APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS). EXECUTIVES, INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT/CEO, RECEIVE THE SAME BENEFIT PACKAGE AS ALL OTHER BENEFIT-ELIGIBLE STAFF. TWO EXECUTIVES RECEIVE COMPANY-PROVIDED VEHICLES. THE CONSERVANCY HAS NO OTHER SPECIAL EXECUTIVE BENEFIT PACKAGES OR INCENTIVE PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WESTERN PENNSYLVANIA CONSERVANCY MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
